Class: Drawer

DrawerJs.Drawer(redactorInstance, options, width, height)

new Drawer(redactorInstance, options, width, height)

Canvas editable element.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
redactorInstance Object | null Redactor's instance. Could be null for standalone version.
options Object Object with configuration parameters.
Properties
Name Type Default Description
borderCss String Canvas border css styles.

Example: 1px dashed rgb(195, 194, 194)
borderCssEditMode String Canvas border css styles which will be applied when in edit mode.

Example: 1px dashed rgb(195, 194, 194)
backgroundCss String Canvas background css style which will be applied to canvas container.

Example: url(/redactor.plugin.drawer/dist/assets/transparent.png) repeat
defaultImageUrl String Image url that will be drawn on canvas when it's just created and nothing has been drawn on it.
toolbarSize number 35 Specifies drawer's toolbar buttons size in px.
toolbarSizeTouch number 43 Specifies drawer's toolbar buttons size in px when running on touch device.
toolbars Object Configuration for each toolbar. Each toolbar have next configuration object: 
  {

     // All of DrawerToolbar.defaultSetOfOptions
     hidden: false,
     position: 'top',
     positionType: 'outside',
     compactType: 'scrollable',
     toggleVisibilityButton: false,
     customAnchorSelector: '#custom-toolbar-here',

     fullscreenMode: {
         // All of DrawerToolbar.defaultSetOfOptions
         hidden: false,
         position: 'top',
         positionType: 'outside',
         compactType: 'scrollable',
         toggleVisibilityButton: false,
         customAnchorSelector: '#custom-toolbar-here',
     }
  }
Properties
Name Type Default Description
popupButtonAlwaysVisible Boolean true Always display popup button(If any toolbar uses it)
drawingTools DrawerToolbar.defaultToolbarOptions Configuration of "Drawing tools" toolbar
toolOptions DrawerToolbar.defaultToolbarOptions Configuration of "Tool options" toolbar
settings DrawerToolbar.defaultToolbarOptions Configuration of "Drawer settings" toolbar
tooltipCss Object Allows css customizations of buttons tooltips. Could be any valid css object that will be passed directly to jQuery.css method.

Example: 
  {
   background: 'green',
   color: 'red'
  }
activeColor String #19A6FD Specifies default active color for drawer(the one that will be selected on initialization).
align String left|right|center|inline|floating Specifies drawer align. Drawer can be moved via MovableFloatingMode only if align is 'floating'

transparentBackground Boolean Specifies if drawer canvas has transparent background.

texts String Object containing strings with translations/texts to use.
String keys could be found in Localization_en.js file.

Example: 
  {
   'Free drawing mode': 'Pencil',
  }
plugins Array List of plugin names that drawer will use. Please see a full list here: DrawerJs.plugins Example: 
plugins: [
 // Drawing tools
 'Pencil',
 'Eraser',
 'Text',
 'Line',
 'ArrowOneSide',
 'ArrowTwoSide',
 'Triangle',
 'Rectangle',
 'Circle',

 // Drawing options
 'ColorpickerRedactor',
 'BrushSize',
 'Resize'
],
pluginsConfig Object Each Drawer plugin could have its own configuration and could be configured by this section.

This is the object which keys are plugin names and values are objects with plugin configuration fields.

Plugins names and documentation about each plugin could be found here: DrawerJs.plugins. Look at plugin's constructor `options` argument.

For example we would like to configure DrawerJs.plugins.Text and DrawerJs.plugins.Eraser plugins: 
pluginsConfig: {
  "Text": {
    "fonts": {
      "Georgia": 'Georgia, serif',
      "Palatino": "'Palatino Linotype', Palatino, serif"
    },
    "defaultFont": 'Georgia'
  },
  "Eraser": {
    "cursorUrl": "url(assets/eraser_cursor.cur), default"
  }
}
defaultActivePlugin Object Activates default tool, if options.defaultActivePlugin is set; MUST contain keys: name - name of plugin mode - one of : ['always', 'onNew', 'lastUsed'] Depending on options.defaultActivePlugin.mode : 'always' - same plugin will be always actived 'onNew' - default plugin is actiavted, only if canvas is empty 'lastUsed' - on first drawer run plugin options.defaultActivePlugin.name, on consecutive - last used tool
canvasProperties Object Specifies fabricjs options that will be passed directly to fabricjs canvas instance on creation.
Properties
Name Type Description
selectionColor String Specifies color of selection rectangle.
selectionDashArray Array.<number> What it allows us to do is make selection lines dashed.

The way to define dash pattern is by specifying intervals via an array.

So to create a pattern where there's one long dash followed by one short dash, we could use something like [10, 5] as "selectionDashArray".
This will draw a line that's 10px long, then skip 5px, draw 10px line again, and so on.
If we were to use [2, 4, 6] array, the pattern would be created by drawing 2px line, then skipping 4px, then drawing 6px line, then skipping 2px, then drawing 4px line, then skipping 6px, and so on. You get the point.
selectionLineWidth number Specifies selection line width in pixels.
selectionBorderColor String Specifies selection line color.
objectControls Object Specifies the appearance of selected object controls.
Properties
Name Type Description
borderColor String Specifies selected object border color.
borderOpacityWhenMoving float Specifies border opacity when object is selected and in moving process.
cornerColor String Specified color of control corners for resizing/rotating.
cornerSize number Specifies size of corners for resizing/rotating.
hasBorders boolean Toggles visibility of selected object border.
objectControlsTouch Object The same as objectControls but will be used when touch device is detected.
detectTouch function A custom function that will be used by drawer to determine whether it is running on touch device or not.

This function must return true or false.

true means that touch device is detected and drawer should adjust its toolbar sized, add touch events etc.

Note that if this function is not specified, drawer will use its own detection mechanism.

To disable any detection simply set this parameter to such function: 
function() { return false; }
contentConfig Object Specifies data-management configuration and controls where canvas element will store its information.
Properties
Name Type Description
saveAfterInactiveSec number Specifies number of seconds to wait after user interaction. If nothing happens in that time - canvas will be saved. Any interaction resets the timer.
saveInHtml boolean Controls whether a drawer will save its content to underlying image element.

If true, canvas objects data will be serialized to JSON and appended to image's data-canvas-serialized attribute.

Note that JSON could be huge on canvases with a lot of objects and freedrawings.
imagesContainer String | jQuery Specifies external data container for canvas images data.

Canvas will serialize itself into base64 encoded png image and store it as json-encoded text to that container.

This could be used for storing rendered images separately from content.

JSON example: 
{
   'canvas_id': 'base64/png .....'
}
canvasDataContainer String | jQuery Specifies external data container for canvas data.

Canvas will serialize itself into json object containing all the vector objects on canvas and its parameters like angle, color etc.

This could be used for storing canvas vector data separately from content.

JSON example: 
{
   'canvas_id': {
       'objects': []
   }
}
loadCanvasData function Specifies a function that will be called when editable canvas needs to load its fabricjs data.

function(canvasId)
saveCanvasData function Specifies a function that will be called when editable canvas needs to store its fabricjs data.

function(canvasId, canvasData)
loadImageData function Specifies a function that will be called when editable canvas needs to load base64/png image data data.

function(canvasId)
saveImageData function Specifies a function that will be called when editable canvas needs to save base64/png image data data.

function(canvasId, imageData)
basePath string Base web url from which all needed drawer files (assets basically) will be loaded. If null, drawer will try to determine it by itself by parsing it's script 'src' tag.
width number Width in px
height number Height in px
Source:

_globalClickHandler(event)

Intercept all click events and check their targets. if target is inside canvas edit box - do nothing. otherwise - trigger 'stopEditing' method.
Parameters:
Name Type Description

activateDefaultPlugin()

Activates default tool, if options.defaultActivePlugin is set; Name of plugin is taken from options.defaultActivePlugin.name; Depending on options.defaultActivePlugin.mode : 'always' - same plugin will be always activated 'onNew' - default plugin is activated, only if canvas is empty 'lastUsed' - on first drawer run plugin options.defaultActivePlugin.name, on consecutive - last used tool

destroy()

  • Drawer.js, line 1296

drawCanvasControls()

Activates on the 'onclick' handler to draw controls ('Edit in drawer button') over image. Redactor automatically places 'onclick' handler on image when it is appended, so it will fire first and it will place image edit html over image ('Edit' at the center). That handler is Redactor.image.loadEditableControls(imageElement); Our handler will file later with that edit html appended, so all we need is to correct button's title and to change 'onclick' handler of edit-box to ours.
Source:
  • Drawer.js, line 842

onCanvasModified(ignoreOptions)

This method will be triggered every time something on canvas change to perform synchronization work, trigger events etc.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
ignoreOptions Boolean Some options like saveAfterInactiveSec could modify this method behavior to postpone modify event for later for better performance. This param allows to ignore any options when {true} is passed.
